Slime Rancher is good.

Currently, however, there is honestly not much you can do in the game. In the space of a few hours, I had done everything there is to do in the game. I was going to wait for a bit more to come out with the game, but I couldn't resist.

That... is really my only negative thing I have to say about the game. For now, I'm blaming it on Early Access. Updates seem to have come out fairly regularly, so I have high hopes that progress will continue to give players more things to do and explore. I'm looking forward to updates that give larger and more dangerous areas. While I can't imagine this game going into the Hardcore" area of gaming difficulty
date: it would be nice to have even the smallest bit of danger from the things that the game warns you to be careful with.\n\nThe slimes are adorable. The farming is somehow less than boring. reviewText:
Early Access Review

How to play Slime Rancher:

1. Buy the game, open it, and be amazed at how good the game looks.
2. Realize you have to do things and not just stand around.
3. Find some of those weird pink blobs and suck them up into your VacPac.
4. Shoot those little guys into their eternal prison.
5. Feed the slimes food.
6. Harvest valuable poop that they eject from their body mass.
7. Sell poop and buy higher walls for their prison.
8. Go out and find some weird blue slime with spikes on top and suck it up into your VacPac.
9. Shoot the blue slime into the prison.
10. Feed the blue slime, and before you can harvest the poop, it gets eaten by a pink slime.
11. Pink slime becomes mega-spiky pink slime.
12. Pink slime leads revolt against their dictator.
13. All slimes escape prison.
14. They end up killing themselves by jumping in water.
15. Cry about their deaths and go find some other slimes.
16. Repeat step 3-15 infinitely.

Final rating: 8/5 slimes cant jive.

2. the tar are very volatile and from what i can see the only real danger.

3. at this point once you get the hang of things, almost to easy to manage things around the place (Bonus for casual play style).

4. all the slimes seem to have a good use even once you have the slimes you want.

that said the game is fun the way it is, but i look forward to seeing new things added to it like map expansions and new content like animals and maybe new slimes.

an optional third person mode, being able walk into ur house, and maybe visit the neighboring ranchs would be a greate addition.

thanks for reading and peace :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a great way to spend your time, even though it’s about ranching slimes and selling their poop. The range of slimes so far are pretty cool, especially the Tabby Slimes as they are cat slimes. All of the Slimes are frickin' adorable, and can traits from another. My favourite Largo Slime is the one that’s a mix of the boom and rock slime, as it looks like the Bomb monsters out of Final Fantasy games, and it looks so frickin' cute. I am really interested to see what Slimes they may add in the future, like Woolly Slimes, or Mossy Slimes, or even Draco Slimes. It would be cool to see more slimes that are kinda environment dependent like the Puddle Slimes; it would be cool to see Icy Slimes that need a cold climate in their cage thing or even in an icy cavern or something or Slimes that can only live underwater, or Ecto Slimes that can go through normal walls of the cage thing and require special walls to contain them, stuff like that. Or other mechanics such as Slime behaviour between one another, like one acts aggressively to another, plus different environments. The amount of different slimes you could have is immense.

It would also be cool I think to add different types of Tarr Slimes and possibly implement a tower defence like mechanism, where you have to add defences to keep them eating your slimes and what not. Or that certain upgrade can be available after certain events, and these can help you get different slimes that couldn’t be captured before, or even just upgrades that allow access to new environments, such as mentioned previously underwater, this way it changes it from having to get slime keys or paying to open new parts.

The only problem that annoys me is how much the auto feeder dispenses food, it just seems like a waste and then having to go pick all of the uneaten food up is just a hassle. Or then again I might not have enough Slimes in my cage things lol. But it would be nice if the feeder knew how many slimes there were and adjusted the amount of food it spits out accordingly.

So yeah I went on a bit haha, this game is definitely worth a play, especially if you’re having a stressful day or just if you want to past the time, and I'm really excited to see what they'll add to it in the future 8.5/10 ^-^

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR Amazing Graphics, Great soundtrack, Extremely Fun, Buy this game.

okay so hands down this is the one of the best game I've ever played

10/10 Music, Seriously! I want to be able to buy the official soundtrack for this game RIGHT NOW! It's so varied but perfect for it's scenario, it is so calm and smoothing it is one of the best ones I've EVER heard.

9/10 Graphics, These graphics will make you stare in wonder and enjoy them, they are cute, adorable and amazing to look at, especially the recent 3.1 Update; the vegetables and fruits have became incredible to look at (with hopefully the same effect coming to the terrain soon)

10/10 Concept, the concept of this game reminds me of a cross between Pokemon and a browser farming game, topped of with graphics, which will both keep you coming for more and enjoying the adventure as you go.

8/10 Content, though some people  complain there is not enough content, they obviously haven't seen the vast majority of terrain there is to explore. While yes, the concept doesn't change and the game doesn't have any set goal / objective,
the feel of adventure and parkour will keep you entertained for hours upon end.

Also the coming on updates will result in ALOT ( and I mean it) ALOT of content,
from what we have been told and leaked:
There will be 3 new slimes coming,
A whole new terrain,
(What i'm most excited for) Letter from home, which will tell us the backstory of our character which will add an element of depth and theories to come,
MUCH MUCH MUCH MORE,

Although I haven't played an impressive amount, I am still in my world exploring the terrain that i am yet to uncover,
If i had to say so, i discovered approximately 60% of the land and I've seen SO SO SO many in developement signs which will soon become so much more adventure and fun!

The price for this game is completely reasonable for what it brings

14/10 Potential,

Don't consider buying any other game, I guarantee you this game will be worth your money.

Thank you for reading and I hope this review helped you make the better choice and buy this AMAZING game,
Peace,

reviewText:
Early Access Review

1. Download game
2. Do the dishes first
3. Play the game for 10 mins
4. Mulch the garden for three hours
5. Finally get some free time, open up the game
6. See a slime, suck it up
7. Make a corral for it and put it in
8. Repeat multiple times
9. Realize I need to study for an English final
10. Ill do it in 10 mins
11. Keep playing
12. Buy expansion for my ranch because its getting too full
13. Check clock, its been 45 mins
14. Ill just finish this day
15. Its day 9? Already?
16. Play for one more day
17. Fall asleep
18. Go to school the next morning and fail the English final
19. Spend the rest of the day worried about my slimes
20. Get back home, immediately back with my slimes
21. A phosphor slime gets loose, name it Luna
22. Realize how much failing my math final tomorrow will affect my grade
23. Ehh whatever
24. Forget to study again
25. Fail math final, still worried that my boom slimes are going to escape and form tarrs that eat my whole ranch
26. Still addicted

11/10 would fail finals week again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

[Note] I have played this game outside of steam, before it was released here.

So In total I guess you could say that I have only played the game for about 3 - 4 hours and I must say that I love it. Being in early acces and having my type of PC gives me a tiny bit of lag here and there but nothing to big or really noticable (or atleast that often).

The game is about the player being a Slime Rancher in an unknown World. Overall you could say that it is a mix between Harvest Moon and Rune Factory - being able to activly fight the Monsters of the world. And yes, there are Monsters besides the normal Slimes which are... SLIMES! In all seriousness: The Monsters basically are a corrupted version of the normal slimes that have combined with another slimetype. If they now eat something they shouldnt and would basically transform again because of it they corrupt and turn into an evil entity that tries to kill everything that is around, meaning that it even attacks the adorable Slimes that it was created of.

Even though there isnt much to the game it has a big area to explore, farm upgrades and upgradable areas and a wide variety of Slimes. And is up to you to capture and combine them. If you do this, Watch out. Like mentioned above the Slimes, if they eat something they shouldnt, will corrupt. And this has nothing to do with what they like to eat or what not. Because what they dont like/dont want to eat, they wont eat. But there are things they dont know as food and they might get curious as to what it tastes like. And then it is up to you to save your little slimes.

It is an early access game and I know how many people dislike this sort of stuff. But maybe it helps when I say that I bought this hours before it was released on Steam just so I could finally play it.

If you really want the game: Buy it. If the overall game looks nice but you dont know if it would be a game for you: Dont buy it. I say this is a take it or leave it kind of game because you will have to invest alot of time and thought into what you are doing on your farm.

This game is great. Keep in mind that this is an early access game and that it is only in pre-alpha. I played it for countless hours  before it was on steam. The graphics are absolutely adorable, the gameplayis unique and fun. I don't have anything bad to say about this game besides a bit of a lack of content once you've sunk a lot of hours into it, but it is pre-alpha as I have said. The devs are very active and continually updating the game. There are plans for new areas and new slimes, so there will always be more to do!

I have a feeling this game is going to be the next minecraft. This game has an incredible amount of potential and I can see it going very, very far if handled correctly. Highly recommend.

If you are on the fence about buying this game, there are several youtubers that have been playing Slime Rancher lately. I recommend checking out Millbeeful and watch his play through on Slime Rancher so far!

10/10, very happy with my purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The cycle of the slimes outside of habitat.

1. Slimes spawn in from trees.
2. Slimes combine into huge rock slimes.
3. More rock slimes spawn, not enough food to feed all of them. They become hostile and try to kill you.
4. The slimes merge again and become a tar.
5. The tar eat all the slimes and chickens in the area
6. Tars give up on trying to kill the rancher and eventually starve.
7. repeat...

Great game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is truely amazing, a good game to spend some time on.

Things I love about this game:
-Breeding, there isn't just the true base types
-Theres some difficulty (Not that much but it's there)
-Highly addicive
-You get a good game for the price
-Cartoonish feel, no need for detailed graphics (Like Borderlands)

I'd just like to highlight on some things that need improving (Remember this is an early access game):
-More plots of land
-More slime
-More customization

Overall, an amazing game I plan on putting alot more time into while it under goes development.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is amazing! reviewText:
Early Access Review

I personally very much love this game.
It's cute, it's addictive, it's fun, hell it's one of the funnest games I've played in a while!

But, and this is a big but, I wouldn't completely recommend the game in it's current state.

It's got a low amount of content, took about 6-8 hours to nearly 100%(for whatever reason the game is saying I haven't played it at all but I've put about 8 hours into it).

I have high hopes for the future though, what is here is great though some may find it monotonous honestly, if you don't like repetitive farming/ranching type games like say Animal Crossing or Harvest Moon you will hate this game, but if you do, like I do, you will love it.

So if you want to support them and buy it now go ahead but do keep in mind it has a very low amount of content in it's current state and like I said, if you don't like farming/ranching type games you won't like this.

BEFORE you buy, if you are not sure, check out YouTube to see all of the great Let's Plays and Walkthroughs. Markiplier and jaclsepticeye both have some hilarious vids u[ with this game. I recommend it for solo players looking for a fun, happy, silly and relaxing game. Looking forward to seeing what Monomi gives us next.  :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ever wanted to gather so many slimes and make them farm animals? this is it!
These slimes are not the average Dungeon slime, These are slimes that hold happy faces and curiosity. You feed the slimes all kinds of fruits, veggies, and chickens and collect their poop known as Plorts and sell it to the ingame market with varying prices to which you can use to purchase upgrades and unlock knew areas. Find giant slimes, feed them enough to explode and collect a key use to explore new areas. But don't forget to admire the Beautiful enviornment and the slimes that reside within it!

Slimes eat other slime plorts to become a slime hybrid {largo} of two species which will generate 2 plorts, 1 of each of it's two combined species. But watch out, if a Largo consumes another plort unlike the ones it makes, A Tar slime will be made and will wreak havoc on your slimes! Throw them in the water quick!

The game is rather small at the moment and can all be easily explored in at least 3-5 hours but still leave more to entertain. It is Very early beta so it is expected to be small, but soon bigger and better updates will come to bring more areas and cute and squishy slimes to the game.

If you are ready to endulge yourself in a world of crazily cute slimes, explore, and earn lots of money, then hit that Purchase Button Like I did. I have no  Regerts

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are thinking about buying this game, please read this review, cause this is one of the few reviews that are actually serious.

Slime Rancher is a game where you abduct slimes to place in your ranch to profit out of them. The gameplay consists of exploring areas for slimes, abducting slimes, and farming for crops to feed your slimes, use said crops to feed your slimes, and sell the ♥♥♥♥ that comes out of them. It seems fun at first glance, but it gets really repetitive after a while. Not only that, but the game itself has a little amount of content for the price it's set at. Yes, it is in early access, but if you ask me, that is a ♥♥♥♥ excuse. Using that logic, I could publish a game that looks good, but only has 1 hour of content for $30. Sure, I could add more content, but you won't be guaranteed that nor will you know when the exact date that it becomes a finished product. I'll give the creators credit for creating luscious areas to explore along with the cute slimes they created, but regardless, they really shouldn't have priced this game at $20. The most you're going to get is about 2-4 hours of content, and that's if you're enjoying the game and not abducting all the slimes to profit out of them. You might be thinking but they're going to add more content
recommended: they aren't Code}{atch. That is a bit reassuring
hoursPlayed: but according to this development roadmap [forums.monomipark.com]
voteText: even though they're working hard on this game
helpfulPercent: you're not going to get much from future updates. Alongside that
votesHelpful: their small team is going to take a long time to accomplish all the things that the roadmap has to offer. It took them almost 2 years (excluding the recent update) to make this much content. That is impressive for a small team
votesTotal: but that doesn't mean that you should release a game with this much content at a price of $20. They could've either spent more time to add more content to this game and then release it
votesFunny: as opposed to releasing this game now and lowering several people's expectations. If you ask me
commentsCount: don't buy this game if you aren't too sure on buying this game

Early Access Review

TL;DR: Very fun game, addictive as ♥♥♥♥.

So yeah, it's a farming game about slimes.
It's really fun, and addictive. It has cute graphics, fun to look at.
The soundtrack is nice, not great, but still good.
The game in Early Acces is already a great game to buy, it's really cool to know also that there is going to be so much more coming to explore, so the game won't have a dead end anytime soon.
I haven't really noticed any bugs other than you might have problems with multiple monitors, since the cursor goes out of your first monitor while playing.

Overall it's a good game, casual, not too hard, and just fun if you're bored. I highly recommend!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I LOVE SLIME RANCHER!

Alrighty, just have to say when I first saw this game I thought it was extremely kiddy and cartoonish, but once I looked at it more and seen what it was about I gave it a try. Its really fun and really stress releasing when you can take out your daily stress by throwing slimes especially the little s*** rock slimes you rush at you and hit you. :p

Its fairly easy to make money when you get your slime ranch going, I always recommend building high walls and air nets once you get enough money because the slimes will stack on each other and get out. Also if you see any wooden crates grab them and bring them back to your ranch and shoot a slime at it, it will give you goodies inside.

Overall this game is really fun and my 4 year old loves to sit in my lap and watch me play it and tells me what slimes to get :) The UI is friendly and easy to use. There is lots of info about the different things you can build and slimes you can catch, so your never wondering what to do or what things do. The only glitch I have encountered is when you unlock the ranch cave to store your phosphorus slimes, if you shoot food at the ground it will glitch through the ground and the slimes can't get it, they know its there and look at it but you cant see it. Other then that no other problems with the game.

Now time for the things they could improve on, I really hope they can add bigger coral cages, I feel like a slime hoarder with all my slimes cooped up haah and I think it would be a nice addition if you could buy an upgrade and make your slime cages bigger. I know you can store food in the silo but it would be nice if you could store the plorts in there, I haven't tried it yet but the description said food. It'd also be really nice if they could add multiplayer and visit others ranches :)

I give this game a 10/10 (Would hoard slimes again) great graphics, barely any glitches or bugs, fun for the whole family, very user friendly!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love throwing carrots at golden poops so that they drop a golden poop and then selling it to make about 300 bucks. #RELATABLE

I love this game. It has adorable slimes, cool upgrades, and TARR SLIMES ARE THE SCARIEST THINGS EVER.
In slime rancher, you play as a young woman named Beatrix LeBeau who travels many lightyears away to capture slimes. In this game, you have a gun. Not a shoot-em-up violent gun, but a vacuum gun. With this vacuum gun you can suck up many resources like veggies, fruits, slime plorts, and most importantly, slimes. You can upgrade this gun to hold many more of those items. You can also buy a jetpack and upgrades for that.

Next, there are the slimes. In this game, there are many different types of slimes. I think at the time of 03/10/16 there are around 9 slimes, including The Tarr. You can collect all of these slimes, except for the Golden Slime and the Tarr. Also, there are larger versions of them, called Largo Slimes.

In this game, there are a wide varitity of items. There are many fruits, veggies, and meats (mostly chickens). All of the slimes have a favorite food, and only eat one type of food. An example is the Rock Slime eats all veggies, but its favorite veggie is the Heart Beet.

Next, is the habitats. In Slime Rancher, you keep your slimes in corrals. There are also gardens, ponds (which you use to keep the water slime in), coops, and incinerators. There are also many upgrades for these, like auto-feeder and auto plort collector.

Lastly, is expansions. In this game, you save up money you make from plorts to buy expansions to the map. Don’t worry, it’s not real money. At the moment (03/10/16) there are 2 expansions. I’ll leave the rest of the secrets of the game for you to find.
Now, since the basic information is out of the way, it’s time for some pros and cons.

Pros
-Fun to Play
-Pretty Graphics
-Simple
-ADORABLE
-Many Upgrades
-You Want to Keep Playing
-It Makes You Feel Powerful
-Semi-Cheap Price

Cons
-Semi-Expensive Price
-I Pretty Much Beat The Game In 6 Hours (By Beat I Mean I Got All The Upgrades and Captured All The Slimes)
-FRICKEN TARR SLIMES (Just Kidding)
-No Multiplayer

There are not very many cons, but they are still ones to keep in mind.

Conclusion: I feel that this game is very fun, cute, and entertaining, but it only has a limited amount of gameplay and it needs some further updates. I recommend you get this game, as they have announced new slimes, multiplayer, and expansions. You may only play for five or six hours, but when the new update comes out, it will just get better.

Zachator Rating: 9.7

reviewText:
Early Access Review

[Note: I played a lot of slime rancher before its release on steam]
Slime rancher is an amazing little game with a lot of potential. For me it's a game where you use genetic crossing to make the best ranch you can.
In the current state the game is in, don't look up tutorials and such, because the fun of the game, for me, is figuring out how things work. And the tutorial is pretty good and explains the game pretty well.
20 is asking a lot for such a small and early acces game, but trust me, it's very good right now and has the potential of being awesome.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is one of the most fun games I've played in a long while! The bright colors, beautiful designs for all of the Far Far Range, and the variety of Slimes and thier behaviors, fruit/veggies/meat with their respective designs, are very interesting and cute which the game incredibly addicting to play.

My greatest complaint(s) is the amount of Slimes that spawn in an area, especially the Pink Slimes that have no limits in terms of living conditions. This absurd number (which can usuallly range from about 20-30 Pink Slimes) in a single area causes extreme lag on my laptop to the point where I have to either leave the area or close the game in fear that will cause my Graphics Card to burn out or crash. This also causes an absurd nubmer of Tarr to spawn to the point where they pratically cover EVERYTHING which makes the lag even WORSE! And it's not just the number of the Slimes, it's also the fact that there are almost always 3+ types of Slimes in one area, which makes the chances of having any Tarr spawn even higher, if not inevitable.

To the game devs, if you're reading this, could you PLEASE cut the number of Slimes to spawn per area in half, or a third - maybe even keep the Slime types separated to their respective homes? Also, if we could get maybe an extra row of Vac tanks so we could have more room for Slimes/Plorts/food, as only having 4 tanks with 20 storage space as a default is REALLY inconvinient.

Early Access Review

Ok keeping in mind that this game is in early access here's what I think of it :)

I absolutely love the style of this game! Very cute and entertaining! When you first start it gives you a very short and simple tutorial. Build a corral, Collect slimes, Feed slimes, Collect slimes poop [Plorts], sell poop upgrade corral, build more corrals and gardens and stuff, collect different slimes to get different poop to sell for different prices. <-- that is pretty much the game in a nutshell without giving away the few secrets that this game has. After you have an array of slimes and an excess of money the game kinda gets a little dull, but once again it is an early access game. I look forward to what this game will become! Keep up the good work <3

Early Access Review

This game has so much potential and i am so excited for when they release te full game! I think it's- oh screw it. We all know the real reason you want to play this game: the simes. -ADORABLE SLIMES

-Using the pulse blast to bounce slimes around
-felling heroic for saving a bunch of cute slimes from the tarr (the tarr are the only things that arent adorable in the game and they go around killing slimes. every time an innocent cutie dies by a tarr, another tarr is born)

-FLYIN AROUND AT THE SPEED OF SOUND (flying on the jetpack)



So yeah, this game is freaking epic. BUY IT

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This has got to be one of the most polished alphas I have ever had the pleasure of playing and well worth the $20 price tag. Graphics are gorgeous, no noticeable glitches or crashes and a great deal of gameplay already seems to be added. Simple concept, but extremely well-executed. Imagine the farming / upgrading aspects of Harvest Moon, the collectability of Pokemon and the gravity gun from Half-Life 2 all thrown into one beautifully constructed game. I've greatly enjoyed my time with it so far and am truly looking forward to watching it succeed.

TL:DR Beautiful, fun, unique game that is easily worth $20 already

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played this game outside steam already for some hours (and will continue here to do so).

As a battle-hardened gamer - have you ever wondered, where all these slimes come from, which you will meet in dungeons, cellars, spooky forests? Well, this here might be the place - collect different (and so cute!) slimes, herd them in your little farm, earn some money out of it, make your farm bigger and better... look for remote places, adventure (and even more rare and cute slimes!)...

All it took me to pre-order this was watching a video about it (thanks, PaulSoaresJr!) and I don't regret it! It is a very early stage of development, but already much fun. And did I mention, how cute the slimes are?! I now will feel bad for sure, if I encounter these in other games and have to slaughter them...

Early Access Review

Slime slime slime, so much jelly and slime. This game is fun. Its simple (yet complex?) and a blast to play! Just watching the slimes do what they do is fun, and finding which ones give the biggest payout is nice too. It all just colapses togeather into a giant bean bag of slime that is Slime Rancher.

There are a few things that bothered me, but i wont even list them. This game is in alpha, its not a full release and it probubly wont be for some time. So, for the time being. Enjoy the game to its fullest extent and do what you will! Its designed well, the artstyle is adorable as ****, and i cannot get over the fact you can basically combine slimes togeather, its awesome.

The game is a soild recomendation from me, and it probubly will be for many others. Enjoy it in any way you please.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I saw an article about this game on PC Gamer, and I just fell in love with the idea. I was extremely excited when I heard that it finally his Steam Early Access.  A very kind friend gifted it to me today, and the four hours I currently hae logged on Steam was one session. I absolutely love this game! I was excited for the concept, but now that I can actually play I am not disappointed! It has the following:

- Bright and wonderful graphics
- Pleasant music and atmosphere
- Helpful starting hints, but lets you figure things out as you go
- Incredibly cute baby chicks!!!

If you are looking at this game and are thinking you'd really enjoy it like I did then you probably really will like it!
I'm so excited to see what the developer has in store for this title! (I will try to update my review as updates are made)

10/10 would cry over baby chicks again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Slime Rancher is very cute and clever game!
Game mechanics:
The mechanics of the game are very simple to understand, which is great for casual/new players. Discovering how certain slimes work and what you need to feed them is a pretty fun process. Also, learning how to maximize your profits is quite enjoyable as well. Combining slimes also provides a unique play style depending on what  YOU  want! I have only played through one time, but I can see myself testing different slime combinations on a second play through.

Early Access:   (Version 0.2.3b).
I am glad this game is early access, but it does come at a cost. I wouldn't say there is currently $20 worth of gameplay right now, but I have high hopes for updates in the near future. At most, you could probably play 5 hours and achieve everything the game has to offer.

Final Words:
I am seriously looking forward to the updates for this game. Slime Rancher has so much potential to be an excellent game. I rate it 7.5/10 right now, just because of the lack of current content. If the updates continue to expand the game with the quality of content it already has, it could easily be a 9/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an early access game the controls and art assets are all pretty tight. I've only had a few Woops clipped into the ground" issues. Which was mostly because I was attempting to climb stuff that I probably had no bussiness climbing... yet.

I adore how open the world is though. Sure in the beginning it feels really confined by the gorge. But as you level up your geat the walls become less and less of an obstacle. I've been sneaking my way up onto the plateaus over and over.

It kind of reminds me of some sort of Pikmin
date: early 3-d Platformer collectathon hybrid. Which honestly is ticking all my favorite nostalgia notes. I would love some more decorations and customizeability
recommended: even if it was just inside the housing pod.  And I think the unlockable ranch areas could stand to be a bit closer. But they are in sprint range so I'll live. They just feel so far off and distant.\n\nOtherwise though I'm having a ball and I can't wait to see what comes of this."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I usually refund early access after purchase because how unpolished and clunky they are, but not this one. Although the game still lacks polish and many features, but the game has good enough potential for me to willingly spend 20 bucks supportting the devs. The game got a bright future as long as the devs updates and improve the game constantly.

The concept is awesone and the graphic style is very refreshing. Here is a list of features that need to be added improved on:
-A better tutorial
-More slime(chicken) types
-Teleportation device(Having to run back and forth such a long distance is kind of annoying)
-Slime status overview chart
-Farm customization(placable trees, flowers etc.)


TL;DR: Fun game, buy it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is so adorable. Once I saw the bright colors and cute slimes on one of my youtuber's videos, I just had to check it out for myself. I can't get enough of these little guys! The game is relaxing and building up my ranch is so enjoyable. The areas and upgrades currently available are great to start out with and if the game continues progressing in this way, the full game will be outstanding. A few glitches here and there where I fall through the floor, but that was fixed after I rebooted the program. Even as is, I feel this game was worth the price of it. Exploring, finding new items, seeing new slimes, it's all thrilling and enticing. I know the year just started, but so far, this is the best game I've played all year. I keep coming back to check on my little slimes and just hoping for another update to the game. Everyone should check this game out even if it's only to see the adorable slimes a time or two. I have gotten so addicted to this game and there's not even much to it yet. I am so excited to see how this continues to develop. Slime Rancher has so much potential. This is definitely a game worth following. There's really no good way to acurately describe what this game is. Check it out for yourself. You won't regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, I have a pretty strong suspicion of most early access games. Games in Alpha are often barely even games. Slime Rancher is a pleasant surprise to me.

It already has a fully functional, very smooth engine in place and a world that is actually larger and more fun than most betas. And it is in Alpha. Even if you explore the whole current world quickly, there's still a pretty decent amount to do in managing your ranch.

While it is very good for an alpha, I think what is more exciting is its potential. The alpha currently showcases the fundamentals of what the engine and game mechanics will be capable of. As more content and choices are added, I am sure the simple and intuitive mechanics will evolve to create interesting narratives and complexities in play.

One thing I do think it needs is a little more threat. Right now, Tarrs and wild slimes pose little threat to the ranch itself as long as you take proper precautions with your greed. Air nets and high walls are nearly invincible, even against many boom largos. A well funded rancher faces very little threat from internal tarr creation, and slimes in the wild don't ever encroach on the ranch itself. But these are all things that may come later, in one form or another. There's plenty of time and this is definitely an encouraging start. I'd say it was worth the 20 dollars.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Slime Rancher is very cute and clever game!
Game mechanics:
The mechanics of the game are very simple to understand, which is great for casual/new players. Discovering how certain slimes work and what you need to feed them is a pretty fun process. Also, learning how to maximize your profits is quite enjoyable as well. Combining slimes also provides a unique play style depending on what  YOU  want! I have only played through one time, but I can see myself testing different slime combinations on a second play through.

Early Access:   (Version 0.2.3b).
I am glad this game is early access, but it does come at a cost. I wouldn't say there is currently $20 worth of gameplay right now, but I have high hopes for updates in the near future. At most, you could probably play 5 hours and achieve everything the game has to offer.

Final Words:
I am seriously looking forward to the updates for this game. Slime Rancher has so much potential to be an excellent game. I rate it 7.5/10 right now, just because of the lack of current content. If the updates continue to expand the game with the quality of content it already has, it could easily be a 9/10.

recommended: even if it was just inside the housing pod.  And I think the unlockable ranch areas could stand to be a bit closer. But they are in sprint range so I'll live. They just feel so far off and distant.\n\nOtherwise though I'm having a ball and I can't wait to see what comes of this."

Early Access Review

I usually refund early access after purchase because how unpolished and clunky they are, but not this one. Although the game still lacks polish and many features, but the game has good enough potential for me to willingly spend 20 bucks supportting the devs. The game got a bright future as long as the devs updates and improve the game constantly.

The concept is awesone and the graphic style is very refreshing. Here is a list of features that need to be added improved on:
-A better tutorial
-More slime(chicken) types
-Teleportation device(Having to run back and forth such a long distance is kind of annoying)
-Slime status overview chart
-Farm customization(placable trees, flowers etc.)


TL;DR: Fun game, buy it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is so adorable. Once I saw the bright colors and cute slimes on one of my youtuber's videos, I just had to check it out for myself. I can't get enough of these little guys! The game is relaxing and building up my ranch is so enjoyable. The areas and upgrades currently available are great to start out with and if the game continues progressing in this way, the full game will be outstanding. A few glitches here and there where I fall through the floor, but that was fixed after I rebooted the program. Even as is, I feel this game was worth the price of it. Exploring, finding new items, seeing new slimes, it's all thrilling and enticing. I know the year just started, but so far, this is the best game I've played all year. I keep coming back to check on my little slimes and just hoping for another update to the game. Everyone should check this game out even if it's only to see the adorable slimes a time or two. I have gotten so addicted to this game and there's not even much to it yet. I am so excited to see how this continues to develop. Slime Rancher has so much potential. This is definitely a game worth following. There's really no good way to acurately describe what this game is. Check it out for yourself. You won't regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This has got to be one of the most polished alphas I have ever had the pleasure of playing and well worth the $20 price tag. Graphics are gorgeous, no noticeable glitches or crashes and a great deal of gameplay already seems to be added. Simple concept, but extremely well-executed. Imagine the farming / upgrading aspects of Harvest Moon, the collectability of Pokemon and the gravity gun from Half-Life 2 all thrown into one beautifully constructed game. I've greatly enjoyed my time with it so far and am truly looking forward to watching it succeed.

TL:DR Beautiful, fun, unique game that is easily worth $20 already

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played this game outside steam already for some hours (and will continue here to do so).

As a battle-hardened gamer - have you ever wondered, where all these slimes come from, which you will meet in dungeons, cellars, spooky forests? Well, this here might be the place - collect different (and so cute!) slimes, herd them in your little farm, earn some money out of it, make your farm bigger and better... look for remote places, adventure (and even more rare and cute slimes!)...

All it took me to pre-order this was watching a video about it (thanks, PaulSoaresJr!) and I don't regret it! It is a very early stage of development, but already much fun. And did I mention, how cute the slimes are?! I now will feel bad for sure, if I encounter these in other games and have to slaughter them...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

(played pre-alpha extensively before Steam release)

this game depicts a frightening future wherein a capitalist society revolves around the purchase, sale, and varying applications of alien excrement. you play as a lone woman who must endure the aliens' own ecosystem to make a profit, where she is prone to constant threats of terror and disaster every time the sun sets. engage in fruit, vegetable, and chicken farming and foraging in order to tame these strange creatures, and take care to keep their many different species seperate lest you unleash Hell on this small rock floating somewhere out in space.

also, it's cute, simple to play, and surprisingly relaxing. it even has an instant .GIF capture button, which is probably the greatest development in gaming in the last few years.

not much to see in its current stage, but playing with what's there has been great fun, and the roadmap on the forums indicates a lot more is coming up soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Watcher Reviews Slime Rancher

Update Version: v0.3.1

Disclaimer: The game copy was bought by the reviewer.

Who would have thought a game about maintaining adorable slimes would have taken so long to surface? These cute little gelatinous blobs have populated role playing games for decades and never seemed to catch a break from the impending defeat at the edge of a sword. This time around they are being imprisoned in plasma and laser cages with the sole purpose of producing plorts that would catch a pretty penny on the intergalactic market. It is not that easy to care for the tiny critters when you have plort evolution to combat. Will this unlikely combination of farming simulator and animal breeding mysteriously create an unforgettable adventure or evolve into a scientific abomination?

Let me get this out of the way: the slimes are cute. One look at this gelatins and you will be making a face usually reserved for humiliating cat videos. You would have to be heartless or down right cynical (or emotionless) to take one look at them and scoff. It helps that the cartoonish aesthetic blossoms with vibrant colors and rich detail that makes even the smallest of baby chickens look stunning. Soft melodies populate the background as playful tones from the slimes are heard over the suction of your gun. Audio used from pulling vegetables to clucking chickens add a layer of robust sound to the environment. It all looks and sounds enchanting with very little to pull you out of it (until the bugs hit).

Gameplay falls under three general categories: search and capture, nurturing and farm maintenance. Multiple slime types are scattered around four main areas with fruits, vegetables and chickens that will be used to feed them once brought back to the farm. It is only possible to capture original slimes, but by feeding a slime another type of plort you can evolve the slime and increase the plort yield. Selling these plorts provide the funds needed to enhance farm equipment (coops, cages, silos, gardens), purchase land extensions and upgrade your suction pack with more storage capacity, health and even a jetpack. The only real issue I had with this was how quickly the routine became repetitive and the content flew by, having gathered enough plorts to fund a fully upgraded backpack and enough rad kitten slimes to shame the craziest cat lady in a couple of hours. There is just not a lot here to fill the span of a afternoon.

Not everything is rainbows and cat (slimes) in this rancher paradise with some annoying bugs and horrible slow down creeping up. Slow down happened on a number of occasions were I would save and then reload the game, only to have a very staggering movement and the world following suit. Clipping issues and terrain sticking (getting stuck to terrain) can force the player to shut down the game to fix. In time I am sure these will get ironed out, but for now the slow down is extremely annoying in more ways than one.

Slime Rancher has taken a unique idea and molded it into a great concept. The slimes frolic in a natural way and look cute on a weaponry level. It is unfortunate the adorable gelatins cannot escape the quick repetitive nature of their capture and exploitation for plorts with how quickly the content goes by. For the current price, more is needed to keep the investment profitable. It is just not a recommendation I can give at the current development level. I will be checking back on these adorable critters with the hope of new lands to venture, but for now I set my slimes free to massacre the chicken population.
Pros

- Adorable level is set to 11
- Environments look polished
- Beautiful music
- Rather fun for the first couple of hours...

Cons

- ... Before the repetition sets in
- Very minor content
- Massive slow down

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is fun and cute. It offers cute gameplay and exploration to see what you can find and what you can collect. However, I decided to review it and say not recommended because although it is alpha, there is little game content and I've owned the game for a couple months and there has been no new content. Perhaps I am being greedy, but the game really only offers 3-4 hours of solid gameplay and a good portion of that is just harvesting slimes and exploring. Eventually you realize that there is only 1 area you can't access and once you access it and get your honey and blast slimes, the game is over. Nothing more to do but harvest slime poops and unlock the ranch areas. If what I described sounds ok to, then I believe the game is an ok purchase, but I fear this will be a one shot game where the developers pretend to update but they never add much content. I have played a few alpha games, one being subnautica which has added a large amount of additional gameplay functions and depth. I have owned slime rancher for probably half the time and there is 0 new aspects to the game. I hope this game does receive updates since it is a good idea and has a lot of potential to be very enjoyable.

Some times you have top really hate the black and white nature of the recommend system.

Now cutting this game to basics what you have here is a slightly more advanced (but only slightly) version of Final Fantasy 7's Choccobo Breeding. Now that's no bad thing what the game does it does very well, it's polished has a whole host of the core game mechanics in and working and is really fun to play. The downside though is the price vs content factor. Having blasted through most of the content, done most of the stuff and seen most of the stuff the 2.4beta has to offer inside 4 hours at a cost of £15 the game just can't be recommended.

It's a very good game and if later expansions add more content, greater depth and or greater complexity or failing that you can pick it up in a sale for under £7 then yes by all means buy it but just now I have to stick with not recommended but let me make this clear IF, the game does add more content then this WILL change.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It is a truly delightful game. 96% positive rating as of this review, and it's easy to see why, after playing it myself.

The big thing with this game is that the progression is really rewarding. You go out, grab some slimes, put them in a pen, and feed them to make them poop. Setting aside the beautiful graphics, cuteness overload of the slimes, and the beautiful land to explore, there's just a really good sense of progression.

After making some money, by selling the slime poop, you can unlock more plots. You can turn them into additional pens, gardens, chicken coops, storage, etc. Each of these options also has a bunch of useful upgrade available to purchase. After spending a few hours, I really felt like I was making great progress, and I enjoyed every minute of it.

There's also a sort of breeding mechanic to the game, where you feed poop from one kind of slime to another kind of slime, and you'll get a hybrid slime. That new slime will eat whatever kind of food the first two liked, and poop two poops each time, Additionally, those poops will be the types you'd get from the original two slimes.

It all seems rather like I'm writing notes about the game, but it's really hard to encompass how enjoyable the entire experience is, running around and taking care of things.

My advice is, you'd be hard pressed to find a game that's quite like this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not remotely worth the money at the moment.

The game is cute, the game is kind of fun, but there's not even enough content for 5 hours of gameplay. By then you have seen everything, upgraded your farm and that's that.

On top of that I didn't find the farming that enjoyable. Plant a bunch of gardens and you'll have enough food to feed the few slime corrals you need to get everything there is in this game. It's hardly worth thinking about any choice to make when it comes to food, or I missed something and still got any content there is within 4 fours. The farming just feels very very casual. I know this isn't Farming Simulator 2016 but given there's pretty much nothing else to do and the game is called Slime Rancher, I'd expect a bit more from the core mechanic.

So in summary: There is potential in the game, the setting is obviously super cute but the money is better spent elsewhere, if you're looking for the most fun you can get for it.

Buying Early Access is a gamble, and I personally feel this is one of the titles I should have passed on.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game on a whim because of the great reviews. Usually this wouldnt disappoint.

I know this is early access, and it is plenty finished for an early access game. really well done and everything.

but....

I guess I could say this game just isn't for me, but I think theres more to it than that. This premise of this game is to vaccuum up some cute lil slimes that come in many different species. and then you are able to gain money" by feeding them for these plorts. And thats almost the whole concept of the game. sure you can do minor improvements to your items and buy plots of lands for growing food easier. This just feels like it isnt enough for an entire game's objective.

PROS:
- Free roam of the current areas without restriction
- Equipment Uprgrades
- Good art style and fun atmosphere

CONS:
- Progression feels grindy
- Any appearance of The Tarr can ruin grinding for an area because it is so opressive to the gameplay
- Objective never changes. its only about progression. 1. feed slimes to get plorts 2. use plorts for upgrades to weapon and ranch 3. get higher level slimes and upgrade more.
- Vaccuum can be infuriating to control. instead of sucking things up
date: sometimes will fling the objects behind you.\n\nI wanted to like this game a lot but it really just fell short in terms of gameplay."

I did everything there was to do in about 4 hours.  I explored the entirety of the map, killed the tarr, captured all the tameable slimes, overfed all 3 largos, found the golden slime, and bought/upgraded all the facilities.  I hope that with updates (the game is still in pre-alpha) this will be a full game, but even if they add more map, slimes, and ways to modify your ranch, this still seems like it should just be a side-game for a bigger release.

wait until the beta at least

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Slime Rancher is original and aesthetically pleasing, but I find myself asking where's the game"?

Traditional sandbox games
voteText:
are fun because you can build a base and optimize it. Slime Rancher offers little in these respects

The player builds corrals to contain slimes and gardens to grow crops. These structures are prefab and can only be built in certain locations. Structure placement doesn't matter as there's no synergies between buildings. Structures may be upgraded with 4 or 5 upgrades to improve their performance.

Outside of upgrades

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't get me wrong. I enjoyed this game initially, but it gets so overwelming after a while. There are just too many slimes. Trying to pick up a carrot? Pink Slime. Fruit? Tabby Pink. Hen? Rock Tabby. Gold Slime? Boom Slime. It's nearly freaking impossible. I have to commit genocide every single day by throwing all slimes I see that I already have ranched into the ocean. And it doesn't even seem to help for longer than five minutes.

This game is more of a micromanagement sim than Dwarf Fortress is. At least losing control in that game is FUN. Here, it's a friggin' chore and you know it's a losing battle.

This game is definite early access and alpha and whatever, and my review may change later on, but for right now, screw Slime Rancher.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh boy, this game. <Sigh>
Look, I wanted to love this title. I really did.

Slime Rancher is a Harvest Moon-esque game; you go out into the wild, and you capture slimes with your vacuum gun, to bring them home, put them in pens, feed them, and sell their poop for money. You use said money to expand your ranch, to upgrade your pens, chicken coops, and farms, and buy upgrades to your equipment.

The core gameplay is perfectly fine - it does exactly what it needs to do. The slimes are adorable, the controls are very well polished, and there was not a point in the game, where I felt confused; the game does a good job in easing you into the game. Its fun, it's cute, it's innocent. The music is also quite pleasant, reminding me of FFXIV:ARR's soundtrack. I was honestly surprised how much I enjoyed it.

... Then I ran out of content.

In 3 hours.

Yes. Really.

The current Early Access build barely has any content. While getting to the limits of the current content was enjoyable, the developers are charging 20 USD / 20 EUR / 15 GBP for this title. For that sort of money, the current content is woefully inadequate. It's a skeleton of a game.

Yes, I understand it's an Early Access title. Yes, I understand that it got released only a few days ago on Steam. However, we had several feature complete games in the past, with vast more content released, on much lower price tags. From a raw value standpoint, compared to the E.A. successes of past, this game is woefully inadequate.

The game does, however, have promise. I would recommend that you keep an eye on it, and buy into it later, when there's a lot more to it. As it stands right now, unless the developers drop the price tag, or it goes on sale, save your money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

http://uncrownedreview.blogspot.com/2016/01/slime-rancher-early-access.html

That's my full review of Slime Rancher but allow me to summarize.

What's here in this game I enjoy, thoroughly. It's cute, adorable, and has lots of huggable slimes. But at the end of the day I'm stuck with the realization that it took the developers a very long time to get the game in its current state, and that current state is both short and buggy. If you press hard you'll be lucky to pull 8 hours from the game before you get bored.

I'm basing my review on the developer's target date of Fall 2016. I do not think this game will be worth $20 by that point in time. Especially with the scarcity of updates and the sheer amount of content they would have to add to make it worth that price. If this was a fully released game at this point it would be worth no less than $5, as an early access title with a more reasonable time range of Fall 2017 or Fall 2018 then $20 or even $25. At that point I could believe a game worth the value was being made.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is cute, but it does not have $21 worth of content. I get it- it's early access, a lot of stuff (hopefully) isn't in the game yet. In addition, in order for this to not be the LAGGIEST GAME IN THE UNIVERSE, i had to put all the graphics settings down to their lowest, which didn't actually change the way the game looks all that much. due to the lag (before i remembered i could put the graphics down), doing anything was super frustrating. Tarrs are EVERYWHERE. Fighting them is fun the first few times, and their sound effects are REALLY COOL, but after those first few times, it becomes a lot less repetitive to run from them and into the next area, since they rarely follow you. I'm really dissappointed because I had several full releases like undertale and binding of isaac rebirth on my wishlist (all of which are cheaper, by the way), and I decided to test this instead. when i checked the reveiws, they were all pretty positive, so i figured i'd give it a go, and i played so long trying to find the 'fun' in this game. there isn't any. just asked for a refund. we'll see how that goes.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've played through this game a couple times before it released on steam and it is an enjoyable and cute experience. However, I unfortunately can not recommend that anybody buy the game right now. Yes, it's fun and I've had a blast with it, but there's so little content in the game (understandably, as it is a pre-alpha) and that makes the price of $20 a little too steep. I'd love to see the game grow into that price and I definitely think it will. But for the moment being I think it'd be a better idea to simply watch the development continue until you think it's worth $20.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For those of you who would rather watch a video about my thoughts on this game here ya go: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cFNBMAxAPlg

Honestly I wasn't sure on if I would recommend this game or not. It is for games like this that I wish there was a maybe option.

Overall this game is fun to play. The art style is cute, colorful, and compliments the gameplay wonderfully. However after playing the game for a few hours (I bought it before it came on steam), I discovered that I was running out of things to do. In fact I had done everything within about 4 hours. For a game like this I think that it should have more content than it currently does to make it worth getting.

So with that said, I wouldnt personally recommend getting it at this current point in development. If you are okay with only getting a few hours of gameplay and then putting it down for a while, then by all means get this game. Otherwise, wait.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The atomsphere of the game is great : the game is cheerful (can't so no to happy slimes!) and the music gives a very gentle and relaxed vibe.

The objective of the game to capture wild slimes using a vacuum and then place them into your farm. The slime also have to be fed using particular foods that are either foraged or farmed. Luckily the Poop" from slimes are valuable resources that can be traded for money - a valuble currency that could be used to upgrade and expand the farm.

There are additional gameplay offered by finding and collecting different slimes. Or feeding slimes to make hybrid slimes (this is probably the most experimental part of the game so I won't spoil it here)

Unfortunately this core gameplay does get old after a 1-2 hours and the game doesn't offer much more in its current state.

The price is a very steep for the gameplay offered."
